alert.note: Alert for Eureka (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 11:53AM PDT until May 31 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Palisade affecting Eureka County. Humboldt River Above Carlin affecting Elko County. Humboldt River At Battle Mountain affecting Lander County. .Warm temperatures continue to melt snowpack. A wet and unsettled weather pattern continues through this week and has a low potential of increasing water levels and flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Palisade. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins between Carlin and Battle Mountains. This is about 3650 cfs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:25 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:25 AM PDT Tuesday was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage between tomorrow afternoon and evening before falling to 6.6 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.1 feet on 02/16/1982. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 145 PM PDT.
